Wisdom: لَوْ صَحَّ الْعَقْلُ لَاغْتَنَمَ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مَهَلَهُ
enWisdom: If the intellect was sound, every person would take advantage of [every moment of] his time

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ بَادَرَ الْأَجَلَ وَاغْتَنَمَ الْمَهَلَ وَتَزَوَّدَ مِنَ الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: Blessed is he who anticipates death, takes advantage of respite and prepares the provision of good deeds [for the Hereafter]

Wisdom: إِنَّ عُمُرَكَ وَقْتُكَ الَّذِي أَنْتَ فِيهِ
enWisdom: Verily your lifetime is the time which you find yourself in

Wisdom: إِنَّ مَاضِيَ عُمُرِكَ أَجَلٌ وَآتِيَهُ أَمَلٌ وَالْوَقْتَ عَمَلٌ
enWisdom: Indeed your life’s past is that which has come to pass and its future is hope, and the present is [time for] action

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَوْقَاتَكَ أَجْزَاءُ عُمُرِكَ فَلَا تُنْفِدْ لَكَ وَقْتاً إِلَّا فِيمَا يُنْجِيكَ [فِي غَيْرِ مَا يُنْجِيكَ‏]
enWisdom: Verily your moments are portions of your life, so do not pass your time except in that which will save you [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: الْأَيَّامُ صَحَائِفُ آجَالِكُمْ فَخَلِّدُوهَا أَحْسَنَ أَعْمَالِكُمْ
enWisdom: Days are the pages of your lifetime so eternize [or bind] them with your best deeds

Wisdom: إِنَّ مَنْ كَانَ مَطِيَّتُهُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ فَإِنَّهُ يُسَارُ بِهِ وَإِنْ كَانَ وَاقِفاً وَيَقْطَعُ الْمَسَافَةَ وَإِنْ كَانَ مُقِيماً وَادِعاً
enWisdom: Verily one whose riding mount is the night and day is carried [forward] by it even when he is stationary, and he traverses the distance even if he is settled in one place

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ عَدَدُ أَيَّامٍ فَكُلُّ يَوْمٍ يَمْضِي عَلَيْكَ يَمْضِي بِبَعْضِكَ فَخَفِّضْ فِي الطَّلَبِ وَأَجْمِلْ فِي الْمُكْتَسَبِ
enWisdom: Verily you are only [the sum total of] a fixed number of days, and every day that passes you by takes a piece of you with it, so reduce your desires and be moderate in your earning

Wisdom: بَادِرْ شَبَابَكَ قَبْلَ هَرَمِكَ وَصِحَّتَكَ قَبْلَ سُقْمِكَ
enWisdom: Take the initiative in your youth before your old age and in your health before your illness

Wisdom: بِئْسَ الْغَرِيمُ النَّوْمُ يُفْنِي قَصِيرَ الْعُمُرِ وَيُفَوِّتُ كَثِيرَ الْأَجْرِ
enWisdom: What a bad rival sleep is! It wastes the short life [a person has] and causes one to lose a lot of reward

Wisdom: بَرَكَةُ الْعُمُرِ فِي حُسْنِ الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: تَدَارَكْ فِي آخِرِ عُمُرِكَ مَا أَضَعْتَهُ فِي أَوَّلِهِ تَسْعَدْ بِمُنْقَلَبِكَ
enWisdom: Rectify at the end of your life that which you have neglected [and lost] earlier on and you will make your place of return a happy one

Wisdom: زِدْ مِنْ طُولِ أَمَلِكَ فِي قِصَرِ أَجَلِكَ وَلَا تَغُرَّنَّكَ صِحَّةُ جِسْمِكَ وَسَلَامَةُ أَمْسِكَ فَإِنَّ مُدَّةَ الْعُمُرِ قَلِيلَةٌ وَسَلَامَةُ الْجِسْمِ مُسْتَحِيلَةٌ
enWisdom: Take away from your long hopes and increase your short lifetime, and do not be deceived by your good physical health and yesterday’s wellbeing, for life is short and good health is prone to change

Wisdom: قَصِّرُوا الْأَمَلَ وَبَادِرُوا الْعَمَلَ وَخَافُوا بَغْتَةَ الْأَجَلِ فَإِنَّهُ لَنْ يُرْجَى مِنْ رَجْعَةِ الْعُمُرِ مَا يُرْجَى مِنْ رَجْعَةِ الرِّزْقِ مَا فَاتَ الْيَوْمَ مِنَ الرِّزْقِ يُرْجَى غَداً زِيَادَتُهُ وَمَا فَاتَ أَمْسِ مِنَ الْعُمُرِ لَمْ تُرْجَ الْيَوْمَ رَجْعَتُهُ
enWisdom: Reduce [your] hopes, hasten towards [good] deeds and fear the suddenness of death, as the return of lifetime cannot be hoped for like the return of livelihoodWhatever is missed from livelihood today may be hoped for tomorrow with increase, but whatever is lost from one’s lifetime yesterday, its return cannot be hoped for today

Wisdom: كُنْ مَشْغُولًا بِمَا أَنْتَ عَنْهُ مَسْئُولٌ
enWisdom: Occupy yourself with that which you are answerable for

Wisdom: رُبَّ فَائْتٍ لَا يُدْرَكُ لَحَاقُهُ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: لَيْسَ كُلُّ فُرْصَةٍ تُصَابُ
enWisdom: Not every opportunity can be realized

Wisdom: لَوِ اعْتَبَرْتَ بِمَا أَضَعْتَ مِنْ مَاضِي عُمُرِكَ لَحَفِظْتَ مَا بَقِيَ
enWisdom: If you took lessons from what has passed of your life, you would safeguard that which remains [of it]

Wisdom: مَنْ يَسْتَيْقِنُ يَعْمَلُ جَاهِداً
enWisdom: One who has certitude works diligently

Wisdom: مَنِ اغْتَرَّ بِالْمَهَلِ اغْتَصَّ بِالْأَجَلِ
enWisdom: One who is deluded by respite, is tormented by death
